result.execSummary:
The defendant David J Cali was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Defendant is to pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 4/8/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment. Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 4/8/18; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: with any other sentence
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Received and filed:  Original Transcript of PLEA & SENTENCING Proceedings commencing APRIL 8, 2014  (53 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.
Letter submitted by Joe Cali, father of defendant, requesting defendant be transferred to Waukesha County

Defendant David J Cali in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Defendant David J Cali in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
AS TO COUNT 1:
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Court ordered Count 1 DISMISSED and READ IN. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
 Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.
  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Joseph C.
The Court sentenced the defendant to:
-Serve 126 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, credit for 126 days. This is a TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.
-Defendant is to pay court costs and victim/witness surcharges by 4/8/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge by 4/8/2018; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

Attorney Darryl E. Smith appears via telephone, defendant David J Cali not in court, in custody.  Jesica Ann Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.
Defense indicates that Branch 15 has agreed to accept this case as part of a global resolution.   Acceptance of this matter confirmed with Branch 15; case transferred forthwith.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant David J Cali in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant David J Cali in custody.  Margaret Kunisch for Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.   No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TARGET located at 7800 S. Lovers Lane, Franklin, WI.

Defendant David J Cali in court with attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Defendant David J Cali in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
